sen.j: 中村 金吾（なかむら きんご、生没年不詳）は壬生浪士組、新選組の隊士である。
sen.e: Kingo NAKAMURA (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of Mibu-Roshigumi (Mibu gang of masterless warriors) and Shinsengumi (special police force who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).

Kingo NAKAMURA (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of Mibu-Roshigumi (Mibu gang of masterless warriors) and Shinsengumi (special police force who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).

Kingo NAKAMURA (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of Mibu-Roshigumi (Mibu gang of masterless warriors) and Shinsengumi (special police force who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
He was a feudal retainer of the Bichu Domain.
He was a feudal retainer of the Bichu Domain.
He was a feudal retainer of the Bichu Domain.

sen.j: 平隊士、もしくは先陣右翼。
sen.e: His post was a Hira Taishi (regimental soldier) or the right wing vanguard.
His post was a Hira Taishi (regimental soldier) or the right wing vanguard.
His post was a Hira Taishi (regimental soldier) or the right wing vanguard.

sen.j: 文久三年五月頃に入隊し、同月二十五日の「幕府提出上書署名者一覧」に名前を連ねる。
sen.e: He joined the Mibu gang around May 1863, and his name can be found in "the list of members who signed a petition submitted to bakufu (feudal government headed by a shogun)" dated May 25.
He joined the Mibu gang around June 1863, and his name can be found in "the list of members who signed a petition submitted to bakufu (feudal government headed by a shogun)" dated July 10.
He joined the Mibu gang around June 1863, and his name can be found in "the list of members who signed a petition submitted to bakufu (feudal government headed by a shogun)" dated July 10.

sen.j: 同年の八月十八日の政変に参加。
sen.e: He was involved in the Coup of August 18, which took place in the same year.
He was involved in the Coup of August 18, which took place in the same year.
He was involved in the Coup of August 18, which took place in the same year.

sen.j: 元治元年六月五日に起きた池田屋事変では土方歳三隊に所属、参戦し、褒賞金十五両を得ている。
sen.e: In the Ikedaya Incident, which took place on July 8, 1864, he joined Toshizo HIJIKATA's squad and won a reward of 15 ryos for his achievement.
In the Ikedaya Incident, which took place on July 8, 1864, he joined Toshizo HIJIKATA's squad and won a reward of 15 ryos for his achievement.
sen.cmt: joinedの前のスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: In the Ikedaya Incident, which took place on July 8, 1864, he joined Toshizo HIJIKATA's squad and won a reward of 15 ryos for his achievement.

sen.j: 同年七月十九日の禁門の変に参戦。
sen.e: He also got involved in the Kinmon Incident, which took place on August 20, 1864.
He also got involved in the Kinmon Incident, which took place on August 20, 1864.
He also got involved in the Kinmon Incident, which took place on August 20, 1864.

sen.j: 十二月の行軍録にも旗役として名を連ねるが、慶応三年六月以前に離隊している。
sen.e: He was listed in the December (1864) Record of March as a flag man, but he left the group prior to June 1867.
He was listed in the December (1864) Record of March as a flag man, but he left the group prior to July 1867.
He was listed in the December (1864) Record of March as a flag man, but he left the group prior to July 1867.
